methods.Style addStyle(String nm, Style parent): Adds a style into the logical style hierarchy.
methods.EditorKit createDefaultEditorKit(): Creates the EditorKit to use by default.
methods.AttributeSet getCharacterAttributes(): Fetches the character attributes in effect at the current location of the caret, or null.
methods.MutableAttributeSet getInputAttributes(): Gets the input attributes for the pane.
methods.Style getLogicalStyle(): Fetches the logical style assigned to the paragraph represented by the current position of the caret, or null.
methods.AttributeSet getParagraphAttributes(): Fetches the current paragraph attributes in effect at the location of the caret, or null if none.
methods.Style getStyle(String nm): Fetches a named non-null style previously added.
methods.StyledDocument getStyledDocument(): Fetches the model associated with the editor.
methods.String getUIClassID(): Returns the class ID for the UI.
methods.void insertComponent(Component c): Inserts a component into the document as a replacement for the currently selected content.
methods.void insertIcon(Icon g): Inserts an icon into the document as a replacement for the currently selected content.
methods.String paramString(): Returns a string representation of this JTextPane.
methods.void removeStyle(String nm): Removes a named non-null style previously added to the document.
methods.void replaceSelection(String content): Replaces the currently selected content with new content represented by the given string.
methods.void setCharacterAttributes(AttributeSet: Applies the given attributes to character content.
methods.void setDocument(Document doc): Associates the editor with a text document.
methods.void setEditorKit(EditorKit kit): Sets the currently installed kit for handling content.
methods.void setLogicalStyle(Style s): Sets the logical style to use for the paragraph at the current caret position.
methods.void setParagraphAttributes(AttributeSet: Applies the given attributes to paragraphs.
methods.void setStyledDocument(StyledDocument do: Associates the editor with a text document.
